Description: Painted wooden female shabti with a black lappet-wig tied with a fillet, a modelled face with black traced eyes, a red and blue collar enclosing the crossed hands in relief holding two black implements; the front of the leg section is inscribed with a column of black painted Hieroglyphs(worn); the back is decorated with a representation of a red seed-basket.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
